form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Marshall (for himself, Mr. Tuberville, and Mrs. Blackburn) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration

form.official-title: Expressing the sense of the Senate that the Parliamentarian of the Senate should serve not more than 1 term of 6 years.

whereas.text: Whereas the Parliamentarian of the Senate serves at the will of the Secretary of the Senate, who is chosen by the majority leader;
Whereas the Parliamentarian of the Senate advises the presiding officer on rules, procedures, and precedents;
Whereas, since 1981, only 3 individuals have served as Parliamentarian of the Senate, serving an average of 15 years;
Whereas, in 2001, the Secretary of the Senate dismissed the Parliamentarian of the Senate; and
Whereas a 6-year term limit for the Parliamentarian of the Senate would prevent entrenchment of power, promote accountability, and encourage fresh perspectives: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: acknowledges that the Parliamentarian of the Senate serves at the pleasure of the Secretary of the Senate, who is chosen by the majority leader of the Senate;
recognizes that historical precedent allows the Secretary of the Senate to dismiss the Parliamentarian of the Senate;
remains committed to using the reconciliation process to return the United States to sound fiscal footing by removing waste, fraud, and abuse from mandatory spending programs; and
believes that the Parliamentarian of the Senate should serve not more than 1 term of 6 years.
